snippet: Frigid temperatures are forecast for a slew of National Football League games this weekend, and Sunday's meeting between the Bears and Green Bay Packers in Chicago could set a bone-chilling record low. The Bears and Packers are scheduled to kick o...
lead_paragraph: Frigid temperatures are forecast for a slew of National Football League games this weekend, and Sunday's meeting between the Bears and Green Bay Packers in Chicago could set a bone-chilling record low. The Bears and Packers are scheduled to kick off at 1 p.m. ET (1800 GMT) at Soldier Field where the temperature is predicted to climb no higher than minus 16 Celsius (3 Fahrenheit).

headline.main: Record Low Temperature Possible for Bears Game in Chicago
headline.print_headline: Record Low Temperature Possible for Bears Game in Chicago
